intro: Radiogrammitis reducta, commonly known as the reduced radiogrammitis, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its diminutive, delicate leaves that are typically less than 1 millimeter in length. The plant exhibits a creeping growth habit, forming dense, low mats on moist, shaded substrates such as soil or rock. Its reproductive structures, including capsules, are small and clustered, typical of many moss species. Radiogrammitis reducta is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
